intro: Urophyllum cyphandrum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Urophyllum cyphandrum is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
